verses.verse: Save<WH3467> me<WH430>, O God; for the waters<WH4325> are come<WH935> in unto my soul<WH5315>.
I sink<WH2883> in deep<WH4688> mire<WH3121>, where there is no standing<WH4613>: I am come<WH935> into deep<WH4615> waters<WH4325>, where the floods<WH7641> overflow me<WH7857>.
I am weary<WH3021> of my crying<WH7121>: my throat<WH1627> is dried<WH2787>: my eyes<WH5869> fail<WH3615> while I wait<WH3176> for my God<WH430>.

They that hate<WH8130> me without a cause<WH2600> are more<WH7231> than the hairs<WH8185> of my head<WH7218>: they that would destroy<WH6789> me<WH341>, being my enemies wrongfully<WH8267>, are mighty<WH6105>: then I restored<WH7725> that which I took not away<WH1497>.
O God<WH430>, you know<WH3045> my foolishness<WH200>; and my sins<WH819> are not hid from you<WH3582>.

Let not them that wait<WH6960> on you<WH136>, O Lord God<WH3069> of hosts<WH6635>, be ashamed<WH954> for my sake<WH1245>: let not those that seek you be confounded<WH3637> for my sake<WH430>, O God of Israel<WH3478>.
Because for your sake I have borne<WH5375> reproach<WH2781>; shame<WH3639> has covered<WH3680> my face<WH6440>.
I am become a stranger<WH2114> unto my brothers<WH251>, and an alien<WH5237> unto my mother<WH517>'s sons<WH1121>.
For the zeal<WH7068> of your house<WH1004> has eaten me up<WH398>; and the reproaches<WH2781> of them that reproached<WH2778> you are fallen upon me<WH5307>.
When I wept<WH1058>, and chastened my soul<WH5315> with fasting<WH6685>, that was to my reproach<WH2781>.
I made<WH5414> sackcloth<WH8242> also my garment<WH3830>; and I became a proverb to them<WH4912>.
They that sit in<WH3427> the gate<WH8179> speak<WH7878> against me<WH5058>; and I was the song of the drunkards<WH8354>.

But as for me<WH8605>, my prayer is unto you<WH3068>, O Lord, in a acceptable<WH7522> time<WH6256>: O God<WH430>, in the multitude<WH7230> of your mercy<WH2617> hear<WH6030> me<WH571>, in the truth of your salvation<WH3468>.
Deliver<WH5337> me out of the mire<WH2916>, and let me not sink<WH2883>: let me be delivered<WH5337> from them that hate<WH8130> me<WH4615>, and out of the deep waters<WH4325>.
Let not the waterflood<WH4325> overflow<WH7857> me<WH4688>, neither let the deep swallow me up<WH1104>, and let not the pit<WH875> shut<WH332> her mouth upon me<WH6310>.
Hear<WH6030> me<WH3068>, O Lord; for your lovingkindness<WH2617> is good<WH2896>: turn<WH6437> unto me according to the multitude<WH7230> of your tender mercies<WH7356>.
And hide<WH5641> not your face<WH6440> from your servant<WH5650>; for I am in trouble<WH6887>: hear<WH6030> me speedily<WH4118>.
Draw near<WH7126> unto my soul<WH5315>, and redeem<WH1350> it<WH6299>: deliver me because of my enemies<WH341>.
You have known<WH3045> my reproach<WH2781>, and my shame<WH1322>, and my dishonor<WH3639>: my adversaries are all before you<WH6887>.

Reproach<WH2781> has broken<WH7665> my heart<WH3820>; and I am full of heaviness<WH5136>: and I looked<WH6960> for some to take pity<WH5110>, but there was none<WH5162>; and for comforters, but I found none<WH4672>.
They gave<WH5414> me also gall<WH7219> for my food<WH1267>; and in my thirst<WH6772> they gave me vinegar<WH2558> to drink<WH8248>.
Let their table<WH7979> become a snare<WH6341> before<WH6440> them<WH7965>: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap<WH4170>.
Let their eyes<WH5869> be darkened<WH2821>, that they see<WH7200> not<WH4975>; and make their body continually<WH8548> to shake<WH4571>.
Pour out<WH8210> your indignation<WH2195> upon them<WH2740>, and let your wrathful anger<WH639> take hold of them<WH5381>.
Let their habitation<WH2918> be desolate<WH8074>; and let none live<WH3427> in their tents<WH168>.
For they persecute<WH7291> him whom you have struck<WH5221>; and they talk<WH5608> to the grief<WH4341> of those whom you have wounded<WH2491>.
Add<WH5414> iniquity<WH5771> unto their iniquity<WH5771>: and let them not come<WH935> into your righteousness<WH6666>.
Let them be blotted<WH4229> out of the book<WH5612> of the living<WH2416>, and not be written<WH3789> with the righteous<WH6662>.
But I am poor<WH6041> and sorrowful<WH3510>: let your salvation<WH3444>, O God<WH430>, set me up on high<WH7682>.
I will praise<WH1984> the name<WH8034> of God<WH430> with a song<WH7892>, and will magnify<WH1431> him with thanksgiving<WH8426>.
This also shall please<WH3190> the Lord<WH3068> better<WH3190> than a ox<WH7794> or bullock<WH6499> that has horns<WH7160> and hoofs<WH6536>.
The humble<WH6035> shall see<WH7200> this<WH8055>, and be glad: and your heart<WH3824> shall live<WH2421> that seek<WH1875> God<WH430>.
For the Lord<WH3068> hears<WH8085> the poor<WH34>, and despises<WH959> not his prisoners<WH615>.
Let the heaven<WH8064> and earth<WH776> praise<WH1984> him<WH3220>, the seas, and every thing that moves in it<WH7430>.
For God<WH430> will save<WH3467> Zion<WH6726>, and will build<WH1129> the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063>: that they may live<WH3427> there<WH3423>, and have it in possession.
The seed<WH2233> also of his servants<WH5650> shall inherit<WH5157> it<WH157>: and they that love his name<WH8034> shall live in it<WH7931>.
